Address.definition: An address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats).  This data type may be used to convey addresses for use in delivering mail as well as for visiting locations which might not be valid for mail delivery.  There are a variety of postal address formats defined around the world.

contains.name: use
contains.definition: The purpose of this address.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: Distinguishes between physical addresses (those you can visit) and mailing addresses (e.g. PO Boxes and care-of addresses). Most addresses are both.

contains.name: text
contains.definition: Specifies the entire address as it should be displayed e.g. on a postal label. This may be provided instead of or as well as the specific parts.

contains.name: line
contains.definition: This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction,  P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.

contains.name: city
contains.definition: The name of the city, town, suburb, village or other community or delivery center.

contains.name: district
contains.definition: The name of the administrative area (county).

contains.name: state
contains.definition: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (e.g. US 2 letter state codes).

contains.name: postalCode
contains.definition: A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.

contains.name: country
contains.definition: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: Time period when address was/is in use.

Age.definition: A duration of time during which an organism (or a process) has existed.

contains.name: value
contains.definition: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

contains.name: comparator
contains.definition: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

contains.name: unit
contains.definition: A human-readable form of the unit.

contains.name: system
contains.definition: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

Annotation.definition: A  text note which also  contains information about who made the statement and when.

contains.name: authorReference
contains.definition: The individual responsible for making the annotation.

contains.name: authorString
contains.definition: The individual responsible for making the annotation.

contains.name: time
contains.definition: Indicates when this particular annotation was made.

contains.name: text
contains.definition: The text of the annotation in markdown format.

Attachment.definition: For referring to data content defined in other formats.

contains.name: contentType
contains.definition: Identifies the type of the data in the attachment and allows a method to be chosen to interpret or render the data. Includes mime type parameters such as charset where appropriate.

contains.name: language
contains.definition: The human language of the content. The value can be any valid value according to BCP 47.

contains.name: data
contains.definition: The actual data of the attachment - a sequence of bytes, base64 encoded.

contains.name: url
contains.definition: A location where the data can be accessed.

contains.name: size
contains.definition: The number of bytes of data that make up this attachment (before base64 encoding, if that is done).

contains.name: hash
contains.definition: The calculated hash of the data using SHA-1. Represented using base64.

contains.name: title
contains.definition: A label or set of text to display in place of the data.

contains.name: creation
contains.definition: The date that the attachment was first created.

CodeableConcept.definition: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

contains.name: coding
contains.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

contains.name: text
contains.definition: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

Coding.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

contains.name: system
contains.definition: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

contains.name: version
contains.definition: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured, and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).

contains.name: display
contains.definition: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

contains.name: userSelected
contains.definition: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - e.g. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).

ContactPoint.definition: Details for all kinds of technology mediated contact points for a person or organization, including telephone, email, etc.

contains.name: system
contains.definition: Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.

contains.name: value
contains.definition: The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).

contains.name: use
contains.definition: Identifies the purpose for the contact point.

contains.name: rank
contains.definition: Specifies a preferred order in which to use a set of contacts. ContactPoints with lower rank values are more preferred than those with higher rank values.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: Time period when the contact point was/is in use.

Count.definition: A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.

contains.name: value
contains.definition: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

contains.name: comparator
contains.definition: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

contains.name: unit
contains.definition: A human-readable form of the unit.

contains.name: system
contains.definition: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

Distance.definition: A length - a value with a unit that is a physical distance.

contains.name: value
contains.definition: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

contains.name: comparator
contains.definition: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

contains.name: unit
contains.definition: A human-readable form of the unit.

contains.name: system
contains.definition: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

contains.name: value
contains.definition: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

contains.name: comparator
contains.definition: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

contains.name: unit
contains.definition: A human-readable form of the unit.

contains.name: system
contains.definition: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

HumanName.definition: A human's name with the ability to identify parts and usage.

contains.name: use
contains.definition: Identifies the purpose for this name.

contains.name: text
contains.definition: Specifies the entire name as it should be displayed e.g. on an application UI. This may be provided instead of or as well as the specific parts.

contains.name: family
contains.definition: The part of a name that links to the genealogy. In some cultures (e.g. Eritrea) the family name of a son is the first name of his father.

contains.name: given
contains.definition: Given name.

contains.name: prefix
contains.definition: Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the start of the name.

contains.name: suffix
contains.definition: Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the end of the name.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: Indicates the period of time when this name was valid for the named person.

Identifier.definition: An identifier - identifies some entity uniquely and unambiguously. Typically this is used for business identifiers.

contains.name: use
contains.definition: The purpose of this identifier.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: A coded type for the identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

contains.name: system
contains.definition: Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.

contains.name: value
contains.definition: The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

contains.name: assigner
contains.definition: Organization that issued/manages the identifier.

Money.definition: An amount of economic utility in some recognized currency.

contains.name: value
contains.definition: Numerical value (with implicit precision).

contains.name: currency
contains.definition: ISO 4217 Currency Code.

Period.definition: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

contains.name: start
contains.definition: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

contains.name: end
contains.definition: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means no end was known or planned at the time the instance was created. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.

Quantity.definition: The comparator is not used on a SimpleQuantity

contains.name: value
contains.definition: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

contains.name: comparator
contains.definition: Not allowed to be used in this context

contains.name: unit
contains.definition: A human-readable form of the unit.

contains.name: system
contains.definition: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

Range.definition: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.

contains.name: low
contains.definition: The low limit. The boundary is inclusive.

contains.name: high
contains.definition: The high limit. The boundary is inclusive.

Ratio.definition: A relationship of two Quantity values - expressed as a numerator and a denominator.

contains.name: numerator
contains.definition: The value of the numerator.

contains.name: denominator
contains.definition: The value of the denominator.

Reference.definition: A reference from one resource to another.

contains.name: reference
contains.definition: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.

contains.name: type
contains.definition:
The expected type of the target of the reference. If both Reference.type and Reference.reference are populated and Reference.reference is a FHIR URL, both SHALL be consistent.

The type is the Canonical URL of Resource Definition that is the type this reference refers to. References are URLs that are relative to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ e.g. "Patient" is a reference to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Patient. Absolute URLs are only allowed for logical models (and can only be used in references in logical models, not resources).

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: An identifier for the target resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity it represents is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

contains.name: display
contains.definition: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

SampledData.definition: A series of measurements taken by a device, with upper and lower limits. There may be more than one dimension in the data.

contains.name: origin
contains.definition: The base quantity that a measured value of zero represents. In addition, this provides the units of the entire measurement series.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: The length of time between sampling times, measured in milliseconds.

contains.name: factor
contains.definition: A correction factor that is applied to the sampled data points before they are added to the origin.

contains.name: lowerLimit
contains.definition: The lower limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value "L" (lower than detection limit).

contains.name: upperLimit
contains.definition: The upper limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value "U" (higher than detection limit).

contains.name: dimensions
contains.definition: The number of sample points at each time point. If this value is greater than one, then the dimensions will be interlaced - all the sample points for a point in time will be recorded at once.

contains.name: data
contains.definition: A series of data points which are decimal values separated by a single space (character u20). The special values "E" (error), "L" (below detection limit) and "U" (above detection limit) can also be used in place of a decimal value.

Signature.definition: A signature along with supporting context. The signature may be a digital signature that is cryptographic in nature, or some other signature acceptable to the domain. This other signature may be as simple as a graphical image representing a hand-written signature, or a signature ceremony Different signature approaches have different utilities.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: An indication of the reason that the entity signed this document. This may be explicitly included as part of the signature information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document.

contains.name: when
contains.definition: When the digital signature was signed.

contains.name: who
contains.definition: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that signed  (e.g. the signature used their private key).

contains.name: onBehalfOf
contains.definition: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that is represented by the signature.

contains.name: targetFormat
contains.definition: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the target resources signed by the signature.

contains.name: sigFormat
contains.definition: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the signature. Important mime types are application/signature+xml for X ML DigSig, application/jose for JWS, and image/* for a graphical image of a signature, etc.

contains.name: data
contains.definition: The base64 encoding of the Signature content. When signature is not recorded electronically this element would be empty.

Timing.definition: Specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used to record when things are planned, expected or requested to occur. The most common usage is in dosage instructions for medications. They are also used when planning care of various kinds, and may be used for reporting the schedule to which past regular activities were carried out.

contains.name: event
contains.definition: Identifies specific times when the event occurs.

contains.name: repeat
contains.definition: A set of rules that describe when the event is scheduled.

contains.name: boundsDuration
contains.definition: Either a duration for the length of the timing schedule, a range of possible length, or outer bounds for start and/or end limits of the timing schedule.

contains.name: boundsRange
contains.definition: Either a duration for the length of the timing schedule, a range of possible length, or outer bounds for start and/or end limits of the timing schedule.

contains.name: boundsPeriod
contains.definition: Either a duration for the length of the timing schedule, a range of possible length, or outer bounds for start and/or end limits of the timing schedule.

contains.name: count
contains.definition: A total count of the desired number of repetitions across the duration of the entire timing specification. If countMax is present, this element indicates the lower bound of the allowed range of count values.

contains.name: countMax
contains.definition: If present, indicates that the count is a range - so to perform the action between [count] and [countMax] times.

contains.name: duration
contains.definition: How long this thing happens for when it happens. If durationMax is present, this element indicates the lower bound of the allowed range of the duration.

contains.name: durationMax
contains.definition: If present, indicates that the duration is a range - so to perform the action between [duration] and [durationMax] time length.

contains.name: durationUnit
contains.definition: The units of time for the duration, in UCUM units.

contains.name: frequency
contains.definition: The number of times to repeat the action within the specified period. If frequencyMax is present, this element indicates the lower bound of the allowed range of the frequency.

contains.name: frequencyMax
contains.definition: If present, indicates that the frequency is a range - so to repeat between [frequency] and [frequencyMax] times within the period or period range.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: Indicates the duration of time over which repetitions are to occur; e.g. to express "3 times per day", 3 would be the frequency and "1 day" would be the period. If periodMax is present, this element indicates the lower bound of the allowed range of the period length.

contains.name: periodMax
contains.definition: If present, indicates that the period is a range from [period] to [periodMax], allowing expressing concepts such as "do this once every 3-5 days.

contains.name: periodUnit
contains.definition: The units of time for the period in UCUM units.

contains.name: dayOfWeek
contains.definition: If one or more days of week is provided, then the action happens only on the specified day(s).

contains.name: timeOfDay
contains.definition: Specified time of day for action to take place.

contains.name: when
contains.definition: An approximate time period during the day, potentially linked to an event of daily living that indicates when the action should occur.

contains.name: offset
contains.definition: The number of minutes from the event. If the event code does not indicate whether the minutes is before or after the event, then the offset is assumed to be after the event.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: A code for the timing schedule (or just text in code.text). Some codes such as BID are ubiquitous, but many institutions define their own additional codes. If a code is provided, the code is understood to be a complete statement of whatever is specified in the structured timing data, and either the code or the data may be used to interpret the Timing, with the exception that .repeat.bounds still applies over the code (and is not contained in the code).
